data.title: Playbill: Broadway, Off-Broadway, London News, Listings and Tickets
data.text:
The production is celebrating its fifth anniversary on Broadway.

The two-week engagement will kick off with a benefit evening honoring original Ragtime star Brian Stokes Mitchell.

Kenny Leon will direct the new production of the Shakespearean tragedy.

The Broadway couple both appeared in the original company of Moulin Rouge!, which Tveit returned to July 23.

Jenney Shamash will direct the latest show from the Emmy-winning comedian.

The Broadway transfer of Cole Escola’s campy comedy officially opened July 11 at the Lyceum Theatre.

Plus, the actor shares how he enfolds being neurodivergent into his portrayal of Orpheus.

Cole Escola's unhinged take on Mary Todd Lincoln has announced an extension.

Andy Blankenbuehler will direct and choreograph the new production at the Kennedy Center.

The NYC cabaret venue announced an August closure last week.

Brona C Titley is adapting the 2001 film that starred Heath Ledger and Paul Bettany.

Find out when the Jason Robert Brown musical will begin its Broadway debut.

The Tony winner on how he stays hopeful and what to expect from season 3 of The Gilded Age.

The free lunchtime concert includes performances from The Great Gatsby, Chicago, The Notebook, Suffs, Moulin Rouge!, and The Book of Mormon.

In this week's column, Seth Rudetsky shares how Broadway favorites hid their pregnancies from the powers that be, and what to expect on his Broadway cruises.

The Tony-winning hit is celebrating its fifth anniversary at the Al Hirschfeld Theatre.

The hit Off-Broadway revival of the Howard Ashman-Alan Menken musical continues at the Westside.

The free lunchtime concert will include performances from The Great Gatsby, Chicago, The Notebook, Suffs, Moulin Rouge!, and The Book of Mormon.

This program at the public park provides NYC students with hands-on experience, professional development, and career pathways.

The exhibition opens later this month at the Off-Broadway company's Shiva Theater.

The Broadway couple both appeared in the original company of Moulin Rouge!, which Tveit returned to July 23.
